  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During inbound sort this hazmat was observed to have a small amount of liquid pooled under the pails bottom. QA notified immediately. Proper hazmat PPE was employed (gloves/safety glasses/outer shell jacket). The pail was placed inside a hazmat plastic bag and transferred to our hazmat cage. DescribePack: spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spill

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Undeclared / unprocessed HazMat appears to have leaked, when noticed it was brought to QA. No actual spillage but top of carton shows signs of leakage. DescribePack: Top closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to HazMat cage, no spillage just signs that small minimal amount leaked and was captured and absorbed in Fiberboard Box.

item.title: Report X-2023101261
item.description:
Report X-2023101261

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged package brought to QA-3 for inspection. Upon inspection, the damaged package was an undeclared hazmat. The damage amounted in .5x1 Gallon of leakage. A SDS was obtained for the contents. Hazmat paperwork and proper procedure were followed. The leaking undeclared hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag and red hazmat bin and placed in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: There was a loose cap and leakage in the amount of .5x1 Gallon DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The leaking undeclared hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag and red hazmat bin and placed in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023101257
item.description:
Report X-2023101257

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA received a yellow savage drum from the SECA trailer. Upon inspection QA noticed it was RTS for being an improper hazmat. There was no further paperwork recargarding an RTS, so QA opened the lid to inspect. QA found 4 bottles of Calci-Solve Super Strength Descaler in a 1 inch pool of its liquid without its original box. QA resealed the lid and put drum in Hazmat cage DescribePack: All bottles appeared to have slight leakage DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Yellow drum was resealed and placed in cage

item.title: Report X-2023101062
item.description:
Report X-2023101062

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package found in trailer # 815468 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of immunocal one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release. no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. package handler Allison adamchick was injured while unloading package as she picked up the box not knowing it was leaking package leaking on her pants DescribePack: one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023101028
item.description:
Report X-2023101028

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged hazmat in a red hazardous waste bin on the hazmat pallet in QA. There is a big wet spot on the box DescribePack: There is no visible damage to the bottle but there were a couple of liquid droplets around the cap of one bottle. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The bottles were kept upright, and the caps were tightened to prevent more leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023101024
item.description:
Report X-2023101024

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged package in damages and saw the corrosive dot on the package as well. There was no OP-900 or a HAZ on the shipping label. It did leak out a bit, the wet spot is on the body of the box near the top. I do see wet spots around the caps on the bottles. DescribePack: I turned the bottles upside down to see where the leak was coming from but couldn't identify where the cause of the leak was. The bottles were wet on the outside of it. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Kept it upright to prevent any more leaks

item.title: Report X-2023101008
item.description:
Report X-2023101008

  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This Hazmat was discovered to be leaking during the unload process. The package fell on its side and the methanol leaked out from the lid. There was no plastic or tape on the cap to keep it closed. There was also no seal. DescribePack: The cap became loose and the methanol leaked out through the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put into a Hazmat bin, lined with a plastic bag.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: I was informed there was a damaged hazmat in a drum in the hazmat cage that need to be processed. The OP-900 was placed on the drum for me to identify what's in the drum. I put on proper PPE to inspect the package by the vent hood table and to see where the damage was. DescribePack: The bottom of the glass bottle is severally cracked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a sealed drum and moved into the hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was removes from system flow due to being discovered in trailer 813090 with a soiled external and leaking. Box was received in QA and upon inspection 1 x 1 gallon bottle of the 4 x 1 gallon bottles of Isopropanol Solution leaked out resulting in all 4 x 1 gallon bottles being soiled and damaged. There were slotted partitions inside the box but no absorbent. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 bottle had loose cap so contents leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

AFTER CLEAN UP OF HAZMAT, RESPONDER TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR FURTHIR PROCESSING. X-2023100405 RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR HAZMAT LEAKER. RESPONDER ARRIVED AT LEAKER IN PROPER PPE WITH DECISION TREE IN HAND. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE FOR PROPER CLEAN UP. AFTER CLEAN UP, HAZMAT TRANSPOERTED TO DMP FOR FURTHIR PROCCESING.

item.title: Report X-2023100417
item.description:
Report X-2023100417

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: BETHLEHEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023100417-EMPLOYEE WAS UNLOADING TRAILER WHEN HE DISCOVERED THAT PACKAGE WAS LEAKING. DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED. PACKAGE WAS WRAPPED IN WHITE PLASTIC AND PACKING TAPE WITH NO VISIBLE LABELS OR MARKINGS OTHER THAN THE TRACKING LABEL. ONCE REMOVED FROM THE TRAILER PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO HAVE CORROSIVE LABELING ON THE FIBERBOARD BOX UNDERNEATH THE PLASTIC WRAPPING. INTERIOR BOS WAS ALSO LABELED AS MURIATIC ACID. RESPONDER CONTACTED HAZMAT HELP DESK FOR UNDECLARED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER: 1Z2766730392612166 X-2023100420-EMPLOYEE WAS UNLOADING TRAILER WHEN HE DISCOVERED THAT PACKAGE WAS LEAKING. DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED. PACKAGE WAS WRAPPED IN WHITE PLASTIC AND PACKING TAPE WITH NO VISIBLE LABELS OR MARKINGS OTHER THAN THE TRACKING LABEL. ONCE REMOVED FROM THE TRAILER PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO HAVE CORROSIVE LABELING ON THE FIBERBOARD BOX UNDERNEATH THE PLASTIC WRAPPING. INTERIOR BOS WAS ALSO LABELED AS MURIATIC ACID. RESPONDER CONTACTED HAZMAT HELP DESK FOR UNDECLARED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER: 1Z2766730392612166
